tool.name: SAGA.grid_gridding.3
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPOINTS False isArrayFIELD False isArrayTARGET_TEMPLATE False output_data_TARGET_OUT_GRID $output_data_TARGET_OUT_GRID name SAGA.grid_gridding.3 POINTS $POINTS FIELD $FIELD TARGET_DEFINITION $TARGET_DEFINITION TARGET_USER_SIZE $TARGET_USER_SIZE TARGET_USER_XMIN $TARGET_USER_XMIN TARGET_USER_XMAX $TARGET_USER_XMAX TARGET_USER_YMIN $TARGET_USER_YMIN TARGET_USER_YMAX $TARGET_USER_YMAX TARGET_USER_COLS $TARGET_USER_COLS TARGET_USER_ROWS $TARGET_USER_ROWS TARGET_USER_FITS $TARGET_USER_FITS TARGET_TEMPLATE $TARGET_TEMPLATE METHOD $METHOD WEIGHT $WEIGHT prefer $prefer response $response outputType_TARGET_OUT_GRID $OutputSection_TARGET_OUT_GRID.outputType_TARGET_OUT_GRID transmissionMode_TARGET_OUT_GRID $OutputSection_TARGET_OUT_GRID.transmissionMode_TARGET_OUT_GRID

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: json, xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: FIELD
param.label: Attribute
param.help: Attribute The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: TARGET_USER_COLS
param.label: Columns
param.help: Number of cells in East-West direction.

param.name: TARGET_USER_ROWS
param.label: Rows
param.help: Number of cells in North-South direction.

param.name: TARGET_TEMPLATE
param.label: Target System
param.help: use this grid's system for output grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid, png

param.name: WEIGHT
param.label: Minimum Weight
param.help: restricts extrapolation by assigning minimal allowed weight for a vertex (normally "-1" or so; lower values correspond to lower reliability; "0" means no extrapolation)

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_TARGET_OUT_GRID
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_TARGET_OUT_GRID
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Natural Neighbour method for grid interpolation from irregular distributed points. This tool makes use of the 'nn - Natural Neighbours interpolation library' created and maintained by Pavel Sakov, CSIRO Marine Research. Find more information about this library at:<br/><a href="http://github.com/sakov/nn-c">github.com/sakov/nn-c</a>.
